heading: intel plans chinese r&d center
subheading: intel will spend $50 million to fund it research in the world's biggest emerging market. also: mcgraw-hill sells tech titles to cmp media.... us west adds dsl markets.
author: wired news report
text: intel corp. the beijing-based intel research center may or may not bear the chief's name chiseled over the front door, but $50 million will buy him plenty of research on chinese-language technology and expand intel's china operations, which now consist of the intel architecture development co. in shanghai.meanwhile, intel's president, craig barrett, is sticking to his optimistic forecast that earnings will pick up after bottoming out in the second quarter.barrett, in johannesburg for africa telekom '98, told investment analysts that he sees nothing ahead that would change this assessment. last month, intel reported that its basic earnings per share had dropped to $0.78 from $1.21 the previous year, on net income of $1.3 billion, down from $2 billion.- - - mcgraw-hill sheds tech mags to cmp: the agreement provides for a relationship between the two companies' publications, including in the past year, cmp -- the third-largest technology trade magazine publisher behind ziff-davis and idg -- has shut down one magazine aimed at the consumer market, in response to the news, mcgraw-hill's stock (- - - speed for the masses: reuters contributed to this report.
